greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = greatest prime of the form k*(n-k) +1. 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: k can take values from 1 to floor[n/2].
a(n)=0 for k = 1, 6, 30 and 54.  Are there any others? - _Robert Israel_, Feb 23 2018
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(15) = 37 as 1*14 +1 = 16, 2*13 +1 = 27 are composite but 3*12 +1= 37 is a prime.
maple: for k from floor(n/2) to 1 by -1 do
if isprime(k*(n-k)+1) then return k*(n-k)+1 fi
mathematica: Table[Max@Prepend[Select[Table[k (n - k) + 1, {k, n/2}], PrimeQ], 0], {n, 60}] (* _Ivan Neretin_, Feb 23 2018 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 15 2005
